title: Letters from Norwegian Immigrants - In Their Own Words (246p) [I
description:
Title: In Their Own Words: Letters from Norwegian Immigrants
Editor: Solveig Zempel
Hardcover: 225 pages
Publisher: Norwegian-American Historical Association (October 1990)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0816618585
ISBN-13: 978-0816618583
Through translations of vivid letters written to family and friends between 1870 and 1945, this book traces the stories of nine Norwegian immigrants: a farmer, fisherman, gold miner, politician, unmarried mother, housewife, businessman, railroad worker, and contractor. Their common bond was the experience of immigration and acculturation, while their individual experiences were manifested in a wide, variety of forms. A fascinating look back that helps the reader understand the day-to-day life of "new Americans."
